title: Add positive reinforcements (not rewards) during player reform
body:
I've been considering gifting people I play with mystery gifts because there really isn't much to encourage positive behavior in this game, only to punish problem players. It's been proven time and time again that positive reinforcement does so much more to change behavior than negative reinforcements or punishments alone. Summoners being reformed should be told when they're doing better, when they're no longer placed in queue with the other temporary deplorables. Being told you're doing better seems incredibly simple, but it goes a long way with people who are actually trying to change their behavior. 

With this, you could even go so far as to add a "positive queue" for people who are honored more. I'm sure plenty of people have suggested skins or champs for people who are showing positive behavior, and I think that's a good idea as well. I mean, yeah, there's the potential loss in sales, but I feel like Riot values game-play more than losing a few thousand dollars a year in potential sales of a specific skin (maybe skins could be made for this purpose?), especially when it could draw more people back to the game who have quit because player behavior is an issue for them (I know it's a major reason why I stay away from summoner's rift).

I really would love to see something positive to effect positive behavior in summoners. I would love to see a better community. Peace and love to ya Riot!

Hextech crafting was their first big foray into positive reinforcement, and I don't think it worked in quite the way they wanted it to on that front. It has to be something that doesn't affect actual gameplay, but something that people value more than free stuff, since the number of people who are actually motivated to good behaviour by a desire to keep or earn back loot is sadly quite small. 

They have more such things in the works, and have expressed significant interest in doing more on this front, but we have no timeline on when anything will be ready, or what exactly it would be.
